pullRequest.title: Added Rune of Unemployment
pullRequest.bodyText:
Approved Suggestion: #284 - Vitamin_CE#9804
Description
Created a villager reset rune, to reset villagers as well as supporting code.
Changes
new class RuneOfUnemployment.java
new piglin drop item (for rune recipe) -> Organic Nether Goo
new research (level 29) for rune
updated piglin listener to include the item (if its % was out of range)
Related Issues

#284 - Vitamin_CE#9804
Checklist



 I have fully tested the proposed changes and promise that they will not break everything into chaos.
 I have also tested the proposed changes in combination with various popular addons and can confirm my changes do not break them.
 I followed the existing code standards and didn't mess up the formatting.
 I did my best to add documentation to any public classes or methods I added.
 I added sufficient Unit Tests to cover my code.

commit.message:
Added Rune of Unemployment

Approved Suggestion: #284 - Vitamin_CE#9804

nodes.bodyText: Your Nether Goo should probably also be added to this research
Don't define the texture here, add them to the HeadTexture enum instead.
This recipe has a rather weird and asymmetric shape
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2466,7 +2472,11 @@ public int getTier() {
 		new EnchantmentRune(categories.magicalResources, SlimefunItems.ENCHANTMENT_RUNE, RecipeType.ANCIENT_ALTAR,
 		new ItemStack[] {SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_3, SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_GLASS, SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_3, SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_GLASS, SlimefunItems.LIGHTNING_RUNE, SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_GLASS, SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_3, SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_GLASS, SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_3})
 		.register(plugin);
-
+		
+		new RuneOfUnemployment(categories.magicalResources, SlimefunItems.UNEMPLOYMENT_RUNE, RecipeType.ANCIENT_ALTAR,
+		new ItemStack[] {SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_3, SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_BOOK_COVER, SlimefunItems.ENDER_LUMP_3, SlimefunItems.ORGANIC_NETHER_GOO, SlimefunItems.MAGIC_LUMP_2, new ItemStack(Material.CRYING_OBSIDIAN), SlimefunItems.MAGICAL_GLASS, SlimefunItems.ORGANIC_NETHER_GOO, SlimefunItems.FLASK_OF_KNOWLEDGE})

nodes.bodyText: Both return statements have completely different indentation.
Missing documentation
Why is this even marked as NotPlaceable here? Brown dye cannot be placed anyway.

Why not do (entity instance of Villager) instead of this weird double-check.
Should Mojang decide to add more types of Merchants, it would break too. So a Villager instanceof check is most appropriate here.
Especially if you are casting this to Villager anyway, since that would otherwise result in unexpected class casting exceptions.

You can also just specify a count when spawning particles, I see no reason for this loop here.
Also the formatting is completely off.

Two brackets with the same level of indentation :NotLikeThis:
This is how you make code confusing.
Why have all these empty lines here...?

commit.message: added a check for jobless villagers

nodes.bodyText: This empty line can be removed.
Should probably also add a "validateInput" method to make sure it's between 1-99.
I don't really see why we would need a new research for this.
Please add an empty line after this

nodes.bodyText:
This description does no cover anything about what this class (Organic Goo) is.
It is too generic.

No need to define o1 and o3 here if they are both 0...
Just use 0.
This string can be removed now
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -236,6 +236,8 @@ slimefun:
   magical_zombie_pills: De-Zombification
   auto_brewer: Industrial Brewery
   enchantment_rune: Ancient Enchanting
+  unemployment_rune: Reset Villager Trades
+  organic_nether_goo: Organic Nether Goo

nodes.bodyText: Use the primitive type double here instead of the nullable boxed version.
Also I am seeing not really much of a need for this seperate variable, you can also just make offset be divided by 2 already.
I think the lore should probably be split into two lines, it's kinda long.
